# delegate

**Instance Property**

An object that the framework notifies of session events.

## Declaration

```swift
weak var delegate: (any NISessionDelegate)? { get set }
```

## Discussion

An app must set a delegate to receive the peer’s distance and direction information through [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didUpdate:)]. The [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didInvalidateWith:)] and [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didRemove:reason:)] callbacks notify you when the session invalidated or removed a peer. The system may suspend an interaction session for various reasons (see [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/sessionWasSuspended(_:)]), such as when the peer backgrounds the app.

## Managing life cycle

- **pause()**: Stops sending distance and direction updates to the peer.
- **invalidate()**: Stops a running session.
